thag6.8:1.1: It was well-taught by the seer,
thag6.8:1.2: the Buddha, Kinsman of the Sun,
thag6.8:2.2: drying up the root of craving,
thag6.8:2.3: and, having cut off the root of poison, the slaughter-house,
thag6.8:3.1: By breaking the root of unknowing,
thag6.8:3.2: it smashes the mechanism of deeds,
thag6.8:3.3: and drops the thunderbolt of knowledge
thag6.8:3.4: on the taking up of consciousnesses.
thag6.8:4.1: It informs us of our feelings,
thag6.8:4.4: all states of existence as a pit of burning coals.
thag6.8:5.1: It’s very sweet and very deep,
thag6.8:5.2: holding birth and death at bay;
thag6.8:5.3: it is the noble eightfold path—
thag6.8:6.4: as if they were in a clear light;
thag6.8:6.5: leading to the great sanctuary and peace,
